McConnell: s interpretation: McConnell interprets the "Orderly Resolution Authority" provision as institutionalizing the experience of the 2008 financial crisis and creating the potential for additional taxpayer bailouts of large institutions. He argues that this provision contradicts the claim that the bill will prevent future bailouts.
Analysis of the bill: The bill being considered in the Senate includes provisions that grant the government additional authority to regulate over-the-counter derivatives and hedge funds. It also establishes a consumer protection agency within the Federal Reserve to regulate financial products. Additionally, the bill creates a process for federal authorities to dissolve financially unstable institutions.
